title: NOAA, NASA, and Northrop Grumman complete major testing for JPSS-2 before launch
summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), NASA, and Northrop Grumman have completed the final major test of the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS)-2 spacecraft ahead of its delivery to Vandenberg Space Force Base, California, for launch.

title: Watch live: Russian cosmonauts begin spacewalk to continue outfitting European robot arm
summary: Russian cosmonauts Oleg Artemyev and Denis Matveev suited up and headed outside the International Space Station Wednesday for a spacewalk to continue outfitting the European Space Agency’s robotic arm delivered to the complex last year.

title: Russian spacewalk to end early as suit power issue appears
summary: A Russian spacewalk is taking place at the ISS to continue preparations to fully activate the European Robotic Arm (ERA) and commission it for operational use.

title: Rocket Lab will self-fund a mission to search for life in the clouds of Venus
Seeking Regulatory Mercy: The case for extending constellation deployment deadlines
summary: Will regulators show mercy for constellation hopefuls battling unprecedented manufacturing and launch constraints outside their control?

title: AST SpaceMobile delays commercial satellite debut by six months
summary: Supply chain issues have pushed out the launch of AST SpaceMobile’s first operational satellite about six months to late 2023, the cellphone-compatible broadband constellation startup said Aug. 15.

title: Blue Origin scraps original recovery ship for New Glenn boosters
summary: A large ship that Blue Origin planned to convert into a landing platform for New Glenn boosters is instead being sent to the scrapyard as the company changes its recovery plans.

title: Orion Space wins U.S. Space Force contract for on-orbit services experiment
summary: Orion Space Solutions announced Aug. 16 it was selected by the U.S. Space Force to develop three small satellites for a demonstration of on-orbit services in geostationary Earth orbit.

title: SLS arrives at LC-39B for launch, teams prepare for multiple launch trajectories
summary: NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket has left the Vehicle Assembly Building at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida and completed its 4.2-mile (6.7-km) journey to Launch Complex 39B.

title: After ICBM test, US stresses it was “not the result of current world events”
summary: Test comes after delays due to Russia, China tensions.
